bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 170, Number 130 (Tuesday, August 13, 2024)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. VAN DREW:H.R. 9359.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 1 of the United StatesConstitution, which provides Congress the power to lay andcollect taxes, duties, imposts, and excises, to pay the debtsand provide for the common defense and general welfare of theUnited States.The single subject of this legislation is:Repeals the gross inclusion of social security benefits inadjusted gross income.[Page H4991]

item.title: You Earned It, You Keep It Act

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the inclusion in gross income of Social Security benefits.

To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to repeal the inclusion in gross income of Social Security benefits.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
